glsa.title: Adobe Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in Adobe Reader might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or conduct various other attacks.

background.p: Adobe Reader is a closed-source PDF reader.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Adobe Reader, including an integer overflow in TrueType Font handling (CVE-2012-0774) and multiple unspecified errors which could cause memory corruption.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Adobe Reader users should upgrade to the latest version:
